description: From New Latin ovarium, from Medieval Latin ovaria (“bird ovary”), from Latin ovum (“egg”). Doublet of ovarium.

entries.meaning: (anatomy) A female reproductive organ, often paired, that produces ova and in mammals secretes the hormones estrogen and progesterone.
examples: The male testicles are homologous to the female ovaries.

entries.meaning: (botany) The lower part of a pistil or carpel that bears ovules and ripens into fruit.
